title.value: Эффективность некорневых подкормок борными микроудобрениями посевов кормовой свеклы
Efficiency of foliage application of boric microfertilizers on fodder beet crop

journal.title: Soil Science and Agrochemistry : scientific journal

person.name: Belyakova, K.V., National Academy of Sciences (Belarus). Scientific and Practical Center for  Arable Farming

abstract.value: In course of the research there was studied the efficiency of foliage application of boric micro fertilizers in mixture with nitrogen on fodder beet (Beta vulgaris subsp. vulgaris L.) crops variety Lada. The research was realized in the conditions of the Republic of Belarus in 2009-2012 in the fields of Scientific and Practical Center for Arable Farming on cultivated sod-podzolic cohesive-sandy loam soil. As a result of realized research it was revealed that the best term of plant fertilizing was a stage of 'joining rows'. It provided obtaining both of maximum yield (783.8-811.6 c/ha) and profitability (163-215%). Plant treatment 10 days after the stage of 'joining rows' was less efficient and provided a root yield on a level of 760.5-787.4 c/ha. Foliage application of Ekolist mono bor (2 l/ha) with nitrogen (30 kg/ha of active substance) at the above mentioned stage provided the highest net profit of 1274 thousand Belarusian roubles per ha) and in the stage of 'joining rows' provided 102.5 kg/ha, and at the treatment, carried out 10 days after the stage - 78.3 c/ha.
